response.original_title: Art for Science's Sake: Stalking John James Audubon
response.overview: Ten years ago, Leigh Anne Howard and Dave Black started an ornithological odyssey to learn more about the 19th century naturalist John James Audubon, known for his mammoth book, The Birds of America. They traveled throughout Scotland, Louisiana, New York, California, Chicago, Indiana, and Kentucky to interview a variety of Audubon biographers and experts about the naturalist's contributions to the study of birds through his art.
response.title: Art for Science's Sake: Stalking John James Audubon
